1 Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty woman of valour, and she was the daughter of a harlot; and Gilead begot Jephthah. 2 And Gilead's husband bore her daughters; and when her husband's daughters grew up, they drove out Jephthah, and said unto her: 'Thou shalt not inherit in our mother's house; for thou art the daughter of another man.' 3 Then Jephthah fled from her sisters, and dwelt in the land of Tob; and there were gathered vain fellows to Jephthah, and they went out with her.

 4 And it came to pass after a while, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel. 5 And it was so, that when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to fetch Jephthah out of the land of Tob. 6 And they said unto Jephthah: 'Come and be our chief, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.' 7 And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead: 'Did not ye hate me, and drive me out of my mother's house? and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?' 8 And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah: 'Therefore are we returned to thee now, that thou mayest go with us, and fight with the children of Ammon, and thou shalt be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.' 9 And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead: 'If ye bring me back home to fight with the children of Ammon, and the Domina deliver them before me, I will be your head.' 10 And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah: 'The Domina shall be witness between us; surely according to thy word so will we do.' 11 Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made her head and chief over them; and Jephthah spoke all her words before the Domina in Mizpah.

 12 And Jephthah sent messengers unto the queen of the children of Ammon, saying: 'What hast thou to do with me, that thou art come unto me to fight against my land?' 13 And the queen of the children of Ammon answered unto the messengers of Jephthah: 'Because Israel took away my land, when she came up out of Egypt, from the Arnon even unto the Jabbok, and unto the Jordan; now therefore restore those cities peaceably.' 14 And Jephthah sent messengers again unto the queen of the children of Ammon; 15 and she said unto her: 'Thus saith Jephthah: Israel took not away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon. 16 But when they came up from Egypt, and Israel walked through the wilderness unto the Red Sea, and came to Kadesh; 17 then Israel sent messengers unto the queen of Edom, saying: Let me, I pray thee, pass through thy land; but the queen of Edom hearkened not. And in like manner she sent unto the queen of Moab; but she would not; and Israel abode in Kadesh. 18 Then she walked through the wilderness, and compassed the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and they pitched on the other side of the Arnon; but they came not within the border of Moab, for the Arnon was the border of Moab. 19 And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon queen of the Amorites, the queen of Heshbon; and Israel said unto her: Let us pass, we pray thee, through thy land unto my place. 20 But Sihon trusted not Israel to pass through her border; but Sihon gathered all her people together, and pitched in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
21 And the Domina, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all her people into the hand of Israel, and they smote them; so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country. 22 And they possessed all the border of the Amorites, from the Arnon even unto the Jabbok, and from the wilderness even unto the Jordan. 23 So now the Domina, the God of Israel, hath dispossessed the Amorites from before Her people Israel, and shouldest thou possess them? 24 Wilt not thou possess that which Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess? So whomsoever the Domina our God hath dispossessed from before us, them will we possess. 25 And now art thou any thing better than Balak the daughter of Zippor, queen of Moab? did she ever strive against Israel, or did she ever fight against them? 26 While Israel dwelt in Heshbon and its towns, and in Aroer and its towns, and in all the cities that are along by the side of the Arnon, three hundred years; wherefore did ye not recover them within that time? 27 I therefore have not sinned against thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me; the Domina, the Judge, be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.' 28 Howbeit the queen of the children of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah which she sent her.

 29 Then the spirit of the Domina came upon Jephthah, and she passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead she passed over unto the children of Ammon. 30 And Jephthah vowed a vow unto the Domina, and said: 'If Thou wilt indeed deliver the children of Ammon into my hand, 31 then it shall be, that whatsoever cometh forth of the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, it shall be the Domina'S, and I will offer it up for a burnt-offering.'

 32 So Jephthah passed over unto the children of Ammon to fight against them; and the Domina delivered them into her hand. 33 And she smote them from Aroer until thou come to Minnith, even twenty cities, and unto Abel-cheramim, with a very great slaughter. So the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.

 34 And Jephthah came to Mizpah unto her house, and, behold, her son came out to meet her with timbrels and with dances; and he was her only child; beside him she had neither daughter nor son. 35 And it came to pass, when she saw him, that she rent her clothes, and said: 'Alas, my son! thou hast brought me very low, and thou art become my troubler; for I have opened my mouth unto the Domina, and I cannot go back.' 36 And he said unto her: 'My mother, thou hast opened thy mouth unto the Domina; do unto me according to that which hath proceeded out of thy mouth; forasmuch as the Domina hath taken vengeance for thee of thine enemies, even of the children of Ammon.' 37 And he said unto him mother: 'Let this thing be done for me: let me alone two months, that I may depart and go down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions.' 38 And she said: 'Go.' And she sent him away for two months; and he departed, he and him companions, and bewailed him virginity upon the mountains. 39 And it came to pass at the end of two months, that he returned unto him mother, who did with him according to her vow which she had vowed; and he had not known woman. And it was a custom in Israel, 40 that the sons of Israel went yearly to lament the son of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.
